title: Keir Starmer criticises 'appalling' Bob Vylan IDF chants
description: The prime minister describes the punk duo's chants calling for death to Israel's military as "hate speech".

title: Israel orders evacuations in northern Gaza as Trump pushes for ceasefire
description: At least 86 people were killed as the result of Israeli attacks in the 24 hours before midday Sunday, the Hamas-run health ministry said.

title: Second 30C day for London ahead of Monday's UK heatwave peak
description: The temperature could climb to mid-30s on Monday as second amber alert in two weeks continues.

title: Trump says he has 'a group of very wealthy people' to buy TikTok
description: Trump says he thinks China's president will probably approve a sale to the unidentified group.

title: Another Jurassic film is out, and Oasis return: What's coming up this week
description: Also this week, Evita officially opens and The Sandman returns for season two.

title: 'Stop!' - Beyoncé pauses show as flying Cadillac tilts mid-air
description: There were gasps from the audience as the elaborate prop, which carries her over the crowd, malfunctioned high above the ground.

title: Iran could start enriching uranium for bomb within months, UN nuclear chief says
description: Rafael Grossi's claim contradicts President Trump, who insists Iran's nuclear capabilities have been "totally obliterated".

title: Thousands in Norway told they won up to millions in lottery error
description: Norsk Tipping's CEO resigned a day after thousands received incorrect notifications, some saying they had become millionaires.

title: Car bomb attack in Pakistan kills at least 13 soldiers
description: Pakistan's military accuses India of backing militants behind the attack, which India denies.

title: Norris fights off Piastri for Austria win
description: Lando Norris beats McLaren team-mate Oscar Piastri to win the Austrian Grand Prix and narrow the gap in the drivers' championship.

title: Rod Stewart at Glastonbury: Old school charm from another era
description: The star brings out several special guests and seranades Michael Eavis in a Vegas-style set.

title: In pictures: Sunday at Glastonbury Festival so far
description: The final day will see Rod Stewart play the legend's slot before Olivia Rodrigo closes the Pyramid.

title: What a night in Glasto's 'Naughty Corner' looks like
description: Over 20 years, Glastonbury has expanded its after-hours offering for those who dare brave it.

title: Full line-up and stage times for Sunday
description: The UK's biggest festival kicks off this week. Here's who's playing, and a guide to the secret sets.

title: Charli XCX, Neil Young and Scissor Sisters give Glastonbury goosebumps
description: With several headliners competing for attention, Saturday was Glastonbury's most compelling night.

title: How dog walks can become deadly when the heat rises
description: Heatwaves can be dangerous for our four-legged friends, so how can you keep yours safe?

title: A preacher asked me out. When I turned her down, the stalking began
description: When Jay Hulme complained about the harassment to a bishop, he was accused of witchcraft.

title: The mystery of the paedophile who hired out Disneyland
description: Jacky Jhaj organised a fake wedding to a nine-year-old last weekend - and previously got fake fans to fawn over him on a red carpet.

title: Who have been the breakout stars at U21 Euros?
description: The Under-21 European Championships pave the way for many future stars - BBC Sport takes a look at who stood out this year.

title: I feel like I've been gaslit - like the life I had before the war was made up
description: The private thoughts and reflections of a young woman whose life has altered course because of the war in Gaza.

title: Emma is doing something she swore she never would - buying her kids vapes
description: One month on from the disposable vape ban, one mum says it has had little impact on her children's nicotine consumption.

title: Most Britons in a generation - home stars set for Wimbledon
description: Wimbledon starts on Monday with 23 British players in the men's and women's singles - the most since 1984. Find out who's playing and why so many Britons are competing.

title: Motorbike convoy escorts boy to prom after dad's plea
description: Family says the large turnout of about 1,000 people had "restored our faith in humanity".

title: Make healthy food more appealing, government tells supermarkets
description: Supermarkets will be challenged to sell healthier food, under a new government obesity plan.

title: People tried to lift tree that fell and killed girl
description: Witnesses say 40 to 50 bystanders ran to help and tried to lift the tree off two children.

title: Man arrested over murder of pregnant mother
description: Sarah Montgomery was a 27-year-old mother of two and was pregnant at the time of her death.

title: Welfare U-turn means we are in 'better position', says Streeting
description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting said MPs raised "substantial" concerns over planned cuts to disability benefits.

title: Lotus has 'no plans' to close any car factory
description: The firm's Chinese owner tells the government it is committed to the UK but said it is exploring options.

title: Man critically injured in Piccadilly Circus crash
description: The car landed on its roof after the collision, which happened at about 05:30 BST on Sunday.

title: BBC News app
description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Is Zohran Mamdani the Democrat’s new secret weapon?
description: Why New York's mayoral race affects the rest of America

title: Music and Politics At Glastonbury
description: Glastonbury organisers say they are "appalled" by comments made by an act.

title: Have we watched Messi's final game on global stage?
description: Lionel Messi signs off from potentially his final game on the global stage with a heavy defeat - but he still shows some magic touches.

title: Eubank and Benn agree September rematch
description: Chris Eubank Jr will fight fellow Briton Conor Benn in a rematch in London in September.

title: Could you return a professional tennis player's serve?
description: BBC Sport presenter Sam Harris tries to return a serve from men's world number eight Holger Rune.

title: Netanyahu says ‘opportunities have opened up’ to free Gaza hostages following Iran operation
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said “many opportunities have opened up” following Israel’s military operations in Iran, including the possibility of bringing home the remaining hostages held in Gaza.

title: Russia’s summer offensive in Ukraine underwhelms – but Kyiv won’t be celebrating
description: For months the talk in Kyiv was of a much-anticipated Russian offensive that would aim to gobble up more of the Ukraine’s eastern regions. So far, it’s been underwhelming – but the Russians have made some gains and vastly reinforced their troop numbers in some areas.

title: UK police assess footage of Glastonbury acts over anti-Israel chants
description: British police say they are reviewing comments made on stage by rap punk duo Bob Vylan and hip hop trio Kneecap at this year’s Glastonbury Festival.

title: Ukraine loses an F-16 pilot and his jet while fighting one of Russia’s biggest ever aerial attacks
description: A Ukrainian pilot was killed and his F-16 fighter jet crashed after Russia launched a huge aerial assault involving hundreds of drones and scores of missiles overnight, the Ukrainian military said on Sunday.

title: Kneecap rapper charged with terrorism offense over alleged Hezbollah flag
description: A member of Irish hip hop trio Kneecap has been charged with a terrorism offense following an investigation by London’s Metropolitan Police.

title: Israeli strike on Iranian prison killed more than 70, says Iran state-affiliated media
description: Israel’s attack on Evin Prison in the Iranian capital of Tehran on Monday killed 71 people, according to Mizan, the news outlet of the Iranian judiciary.

title: In pictures: The world reacts to Pope Francis’ death
75 years after he was kidnapped to North Korea, these sisters still hope to see their brother
description: Min Young-jae has not seen or heard anything about her eldest brother for 75 years. He was 19 and she was only 2 when, during the early days of the Korean War, he was kidnapped to the North.

title: As two African nations sign a peace deal, Trump wants credit. But some fear peace may still elude them
description: A peace agreement brokered by the White House to stem the bloodshed in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), where a militia allegedly backed by Rwanda occupies vast swaths of land, was signed in Washington D.C. on Friday by officials of the two African nations.

title: How authorities found a drug kingpin’s luxurious hideout in Ecuador
description: Ecuadorian forces have revealed how they captured the country’s most-wanted man, drug lord Adolfo “Fito” Macías, more than a year after his brazen prison escape prompted the president to declare an internal armed conflict to crack down on the country’s most violent gangs.
